verses.verse: A Psalm of David.<WH1732> Plead<WH7378> my cause, O LORD,<WH3068> with<WH854> them that strive<WH3401> with me: fight against<WH3898> <WH853> them that fight against<WH3898> me.
Take hold<WH2388> of shield<WH4043> and buckler,<WH6793> and stand up<WH6965> for mine help.<WH5833>
Draw out<WH7324> also the spear,<WH2595> and stop<WH5462> the way against<WH7125> them that persecute<WH7291> me: say<WH559> unto my soul,<WH5315> I<WH589> am thy salvation.<WH3444>

Let them be confounded<WH954> and put to shame<WH3637> that seek after<WH1245> my soul:<WH5315> let them be turned<WH5472> back<WH268> and brought to confusion<WH2659> that devise<WH2803> my hurt.<WH7451>
Let them be<WH1961> as chaff<WH4671> before<WH6440> the wind:<WH7307> and let the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> chase<WH1760> them.
Let their way<WH1870> be<WH1961> dark<WH2822> and slippery:<WH2519> and let the angel<WH4397> of the LORD<WH3068> persecute<WH7291> them.
For <WH3588> without cause<WH2600> have they hid<WH2934> for me their net<WH7568> in a pit,<WH7845> which without cause<WH2600> they have digged<WH2658> for my soul.<WH5315>

Let destruction<WH7722> come upon<WH935> him at unawares;<WH3808> <WH3045> and let his net<WH7568> that<WH834> he hath hid<WH2934> catch<WH3920> himself: into that very destruction<WH7722> let him fall.<WH5307>
And my soul<WH5315> shall be joyful<WH1523> in the LORD:<WH3068> it shall rejoice<WH7797> in his salvation.<WH3444>

All <WH3605> my bones<WH6106> shall say,<WH559> LORD,<WH3068> who<WH4310> is like unto thee,<WH3644> which deliverest<WH5337> the poor<WH6041> from him that is too strong<WH4480> <WH2389> for<WH4480> him, yea, the poor<WH6041> and the needy<WH34> from him that spoileth<WH4480> <WH1497> him?
False <WH2555> witnesses<WH5707> did rise up;<WH6965> they laid to my charge<WH7592> things that<WH834> I knew<WH3045> not.<WH3808>
They rewarded<WH7999> me evil<WH7451> for<WH8478> good<WH2896> to the spoiling<WH7908> of my soul.<WH5315>

But as for me,<WH589> when they were sick,<WH2470> my clothing<WH3830> was sackcloth:<WH8242> I humbled<WH6031> my soul<WH5315> with fasting;<WH6685> and my prayer<WH8605> returned<WH7725> into<WH5921> mine own bosom.<WH2436>
I behaved myself<WH1980> as though he had been my friend<WH7453> or brother:<WH251> I bowed down<WH7817> heavily,<WH6937> as one that mourneth<WH57> for his mother.<WH517>

But in mine adversity<WH6761> they rejoiced,<WH8055> and gathered themselves together:<WH622> yea, the abjects<WH5222> gathered themselves together<WH622> against<WH5921> me, and I knew<WH3045> it not;<WH3808> they did tear<WH7167> me, and ceased<WH1826> not: <WH3808>
With hypocritical<WH2611> mockers<WH3934> in feasts,<WH4580> they gnashed<WH2786> upon<WH5921> me with their teeth.<WH8127>
Lord, <WH136> how long<WH4100> wilt thou look on?<WH7200> rescue<WH7725> my soul<WH5315> from their destructions,<WH4480> <WH7722> my darling<WH3173> from the lions.<WH4480> <WH3715>
I will give thee thanks<WH3034> in the great<WH7227> congregation:<WH6951> I will praise<WH1984> thee among much<WH6099> people.<WH5971>
Let not<WH408> them that are mine enemies<WH341> wrongfully<WH8267> rejoice<WH8055> over me: neither let them wink<WH7169> with the eye<WH5869> that hate<WH8130> me without a cause.<WH2600>
For <WH3588> they speak<WH1696> not<WH3808> peace:<WH7965> but they devise<WH2803> deceitful<WH4820> matters<WH1697> against<WH5921> them that are quiet<WH7282> in the land.<WH776>
Yea, they opened<WH7337> their mouth<WH6310> wide against<WH5921> me, and said,<WH559> Aha,<WH1889> aha,<WH1889> our eye<WH5869> hath seen<WH7200> it.
This thou hast seen,<WH7200> O LORD:<WH3068> keep not<WH408> silence:<WH2790> O Lord,<WH136> be not<WH408> far<WH7368> from<WH4480> me.
Stir up thyself,<WH5782> and awake<WH6974> to my judgment,<WH4941> even unto my cause,<WH7379> my God<WH430> and my Lord.<WH136>
Judge <WH8199> me, O LORD<WH3068> my God,<WH430> according to thy righteousness;<WH6664> and let them not<WH408> rejoice<WH8055> over me.
Let them not<WH408> say<WH559> in their hearts,<WH3820> Ah,<WH1889> so would we have it:<WH5315> let them not<WH408> say,<WH559> We have swallowed him up.<WH1104>

Let them be ashamed<WH954> and brought to confusion<WH2659> together<WH3162> that rejoice<WH8056> at mine hurt:<WH7451> let them be clothed<WH3847> with shame<WH1322> and dishonor<WH3639> that magnify<WH1431> themselves against<WH5921> me.

Let them shout for joy,<WH7442> and be glad,<WH8055> that favor<WH2655> my righteous cause:<WH6664> yea, let them say<WH559> continually,<WH8548> Let the LORD<WH3068> be magnified,<WH1431> which hath pleasure<WH2655> in the prosperity<WH7965> of his servant.<WH5650>
And my tongue<WH3956> shall speak<WH1897> of thy righteousness<WH6664> and of thy praise<WH8416> all<WH3605> the day<WH3117> long.
